p: Leanyer virus (LEAV) was isolated from An. meraukensis pools in a suburb of Darwin, Australia in 1974, and was cultivable on BHK-2I and Vero cells [ 48]. Peptide sequence analysis indicated that LEAV is related to Oropouche virus with 59% similarity in the polymerase sequence. LEAV does not cross-react serologically with other orthobunyaviruses and the L and S segment peptide sequences display divergence from other orthobunyaviruses, and therefore LEAV could be considered as a new antigenic complex [ 89].
